creator: mike.price@foundstone.com
text:
In the default installation of Tomcat 4.0-b1 & b7 (untested on other versions), 
the process/code block responsible for handling communications on the Server 
administration? port (defined in conf/server.xml in the 'Server' element as 
8005 by default) is susceptible to a denial of service 'attack'. By sending a 
large amount of data (70mb+) to this port, an attacker can cause the Catalina 
(tomcat servlet container?) process to exit presumably from an 
OutOfMemoryError. No shutdown string is required to accomplish this.
